meanings.definition: Capable of being put into use or action.
meanings.sent1: The new equipment is exercisable and ready for operation.
meanings.sent2: The exercisable tools in the shed make gardening easier.
meanings.sent3: The exercisable remote control made the cat chase after it.
meanings.sent4: Her exercisable imagination led to creative solutions.
meanings.sent5: The exercisable car engine roared to life with a turn of the key.

meanings.definition: Able to be used or utilized.
meanings.sent1: The exercisable skills he learned helped him in his job.
meanings.sent2: The exercisable resources were crucial during the crisis.
meanings.sent3: She found the exercisable umbrella in the closet just in time for the rain.
meanings.sent4: His exercisable knowledge of computers impressed his classmates.
meanings.sent5: The exercisable map guided them safely through the forest.

meanings.sent1: The exercisable stock options gave employees a chance to invest.
meanings.sent2: The exercisable gym membership allowed her access to all facilities.
meanings.sent3: He found the exercisable coupon for a free meal hidden in his wallet.
meanings.sent4: The exercisable voting rights ensured everyone had a say.
meanings.sent5: The exercisable warranty covered any defects in the product.
